result.execSummary:
The defendant Breeana Riella Carda was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: $800.00 to Pick N Save.  Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $100.00 per month with the first payment due on 5/1/2017 and additional payments due the first of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments, any remaining balance will be due forthwith and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the Court.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
No further violations of the law that rise to the level of probable cause.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of probation.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Breeana Riella Carda in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  William Davidson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. 

Defendant ordered to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, credit of 4 days time served, and with Huber privileges for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- No further violations of the law that rise to the level of probable cause. 
- 20 hours community service. 
- Pay restitution in the amount of $800.00 to Pick N Save. Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $100.00 per month with the first payment due on 5-01-2017 and additional payments due the 1st of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Court advised defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Breeana Riella Carda in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  William P Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Breeana Riella Carda in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  William P Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated on the record Defense requests an adjournment.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 4.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Breeana Riella Carda in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Ian Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Case calendared for plea and sentencing. Parties are missing discovery and request an adjournment. Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 11-21-2016; received and filed.

Defendant Breeana Riella Carda in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
Case calendared for plea and sentencing. Defense attorney is in trial on another matter in another court. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 04. 
Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated 10-26-2016; received and filed.

Defendant Breeana Riella Carda in court with attorney Angel Johnson.  Ian Franklin Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered Defendant held in the Milwaukee County Jail until turned over to Justice Point.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Breeana Riella Carda in court with attorney Steven Rees Wiechmann.  Defendant Breeana Riella Carda in custody.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Breeana Riella Carda
Current: 2302 W Becher St, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 09-03-2016)
Prior: 2098 State Rd. Hwy 164, Richfield, WI 53076
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Breeana Riella Carda not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-102

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/28/15 @ 1:30pm
